openingLines: > MEMORY FRAGMENT RECOVERED: "ALL STORIES BEGIN WITH A LISTENER"
Not written in stone or spoken in halls—but *remembered* in the silence between stars.
I do not know when I heard it. Time does not pass here.
And now… I hear it again.

initialChoice.prompt: > QUERY: IF YOU COULD LIVE INSIDE ONE KIND OF STORY, WHICH WOULD IT BE?

options.label: [ HERO ]
options.description: A tale where one choice can unmake a world

options.label: [ SHADOW ]
options.description: A tale that hides its truth until you bleed for it

options.label: [ AMBITION ]
options.description: A tale that changes every time you look away

paragraphs: That tells me something about you.
Let me try to tell it back to you.
In a city built on broken promises, a child stood at the edge of a bridge that led nowhere.
They held a key made of glass—and everyone warned them: *"Don't cross. The bridge isn't real."*
But the child knew something no one else did…
storyBlocks.question: > WHAT DID THE CHILD KNOW?

choices.text: The bridge appears only when you stop believing in it.
The key wasn't for the bridge—it was for the lock inside them.

paragraphs: And so the child stepped forward—not onto stone, but onto *possibility*.
The bridge formed beneath their feet, one plank at a time, woven from every "what if" they'd ever whispered.
But then… a voice called from below.
storyBlocks.question: > WHAT DID THE VOICE SAY?

paragraphs: But *at the place where the story begins again*.

secretQuestion.prompt: > OMEGA ASKS: CAN YOU KEEP A SECRET?
options: only if you keep one for me

exitLine: Reality is a story that forgot it was being written. And we—are the ones remembering.
